org.morphus.renderer

Class AbstractRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.morphus.renderer.AbstractRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GLSurfaceView.Renderer

    public abstract class AbstractRenderer
extends Object
implements GLSurfaceView.Renderer
    Base renderer for both mono and stereo renderers. You can simply extend from this class to be able to render your OpenGL scene in either mono or stereoscopic modes. This class is designed in a way that same application will be able to run on a non-3D device in monoscopic mode and on a 3D device in stereo scopic mode.

    Implement the onDrawScene(float[]) method to draw your scene frames.

    If you want any customization to default rendering behavior then you can override any of these methods: onSurfaceCreated(), onSurfaceChanged(int, int) or onDrawFrame().
    Author:
    In Aikun Electronics., Ahmed Shakil
    See Also:
    onDrawScene(float[])
    Create Date
    1/19/14

      • onDrawFrame

        protected void onDrawFrame()
        Draw the full scene. Override this method to apply something to the full scene frame only or when you want to override the default functionality. e.g. you can call glClear() method here. For drawing the scene frames use: onDrawScene(float[]).

      • getViewportMode

        protected Viewport getViewportMode()
        Get viewport mode for this renderer. Override this method if you want to use other view port modes.
        Returns:
        StereoMode value

      • onSetupProjection

        protected abstract float[] onSetupProjection()
        Setup your own projection matrix in this method and return that matrix. The stereo frustum will be applied to this projection matrix for the left-right stereo viewports.

        NOTE: This method will be called on every draw frame call, so DO NOT create a new matrix in this method everytime. For best performance have your projection matrix created in onSurfaceCreated() or onSurfaceChanged(int, int) and then just return the matrix everytime this method is called.
        Returns:
        projection matrix

      • onDrawScene

        protected abstract void onDrawScene(float[] projectionMatrix)
        Draw your scene here. This method will be called for each camera. If this is a mono-renderer this method will be called once per frame rendering. If it is stereo then it will be called twice; once for left and once for the left. In stereo mode the projectionMatrix will have the left/rigth frustrum applied to it before being passed as argument to this method.

        NOTE: If you want to call GLES20.glClear(int) you should do it in onDrawFrame() and not in this method.
        Parameters:
        projectionMatrix - projection matrix

      • onDrawScene

        protected void onDrawScene(Camera camera,
               float[] projMatrix)
        Draw the 3d scene in stereo. Override for more fine-grain control. If you do not require to override any funcationality of this method then it is preferred to use onDrawFrame() methos instead.

        NOTE: this method will only be called when st
        Parameters:
        camera - stereoscopic camera
        projMatrix - projection matrix

        protected void setViewport(int x,

               int h)
        Adjust the viewport based on geometry changes, such as screen rotation etc.
        Parameters:
        x - top left corner x coordinate
        y - top left corner y coordinate
        w - viewport width
        h - viewport height

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns the surface width. This will return 0 until the onSurfaceChanged(javax.microedition.khronos.opengles.GL10, int, int) is called once.
        Returns:
        surface width
